wikipedia_page.main:
George Wilfred Mee (12 April 1900 – July 1978) was an English professional footballer. He played as a midfielder.
Nicknamed the Mighty Atom, he was the older brother of former Arsenal manager Bertie Mee.

response: Mee was made an OBE in 1984 for services to football.United Kingdom list:  He was the younger brother of fellow footballer Georgie Mee. He died in London at the age of 82, in 2001.
*Georgie Mee (1900–1978), footballer, older brother of Bertie Mee

link_mentions.page: List of Blackpool F.C. records and statistics
response: *Most consecutive League appearances: Georgie Mee (195; between 25 December 1920 and 12 September 1925)

Brown left the club at the end of the season, and was replaced by Sam Ellis. Pashley was ever-present for the second consecutive season. His 53 appearances in 1982–83 meant he had made 106 consecutive appearances for Blackpool. This was, however, a long way short of Georgie Mee's record of 195 consecutive league appearances for the club. Pashley spent a large portion of the season up front alongside Dave Bamber, and scored three league goals (two from the penalty spot). He also helped put Blackpool into the second round of the FA Cup by scoring in their first-round victory at Horwich R.M.I. He also scored two goals in the League Cup.Calley, Roy (1992). Blackpool: A Complete Record 1887–1992, Breedon Books Sport, p. 340
